properties.name: 10 Woodsgate Avenue
properties.description: Ms Margaret Lawrence (25), Ms Margaret I. Lawrence (55) and Ms Caroline Massey (68) killed.

properties.name: 144 De La Warr Road
properties.description: A bomb struck a house chimney on the opposite side of De La Warr Road, flew across the road to number 144. It entered the bedroom window, crossed the landing and exited the house at the rear before exploding on the open ground. The damage rendered the house inhabitable and adjacent houses had their windows blown in.

properties.name: 19 Dalehurst Road
properties.description: Mrs Harriet R. Tidd (23) of number 30 Dalehurst Road killed.

properties.name: 27-31 Devonshire Road
properties.description: Mid day raid. 6 bombs. Three buildings destroyed. 3 Killed, 22 injured. Shops destroyed: Perrett & Co chemist, Hilton & Sons boot makers, Flinn & Sons dyers and cleaners and H. Carter butcher. Mr Alfred V. Barker (19) delivery boy, Ms Violet B. Rose (27) shop assistant at Flinn's and Mr Frederick G. Kerley (70), a passer-by, were killed.

properties.name: 30 Cantelupe Road
properties.description: Landed in garden but did not explode until five hours later. Caused upheaval of the road and displacement of roof tiles on surrounding houses. No casualties.

properties.name: 34 St Leonard's Road. L.J. Collis & Co Chemist
properties.description: Shop destroyed and proprietor Mr Leslie J. Collis (44) killed.

properties.name: 35 Station Road
properties.description: Mr William G. Reeves (53) killed at his newsagent shop.

properties.name: 4 Millfield Rise
properties.description: Unexploded bomb discovered, possibly dropped 08 October.

properties.name: 42 Bancroft Road
properties.description: Sisters Ms Annie L Coverdale (75) and Ms Evelyn Coverdale (62) occupants of No 42 taken to Bexhill Hospital where they died. 2 others injured. No 40 also destroyed and 44 and 46 damaged.

properties.name: 5 Gloucester Avenue
properties.description: Considerable blast damage done.  The homes of Mrs Henrietta Watson, elderly, and next door, daughter in law Mrs Iris Watson and her daughter Ann Watson (4) were destroyed. All three taken to hospital by  ambulance. Ann died. Eight people injured. Residents of Gloucester Avenue evacuated.

properties.name: 57 Amherst Road
properties.description: Heavy raid injuring five people. Mr Thomas Mepham (69) and his brother in law Mr William Turner (62) taken to hospital at Epsom where they both subsequently died.

properties.name: 57 Devonshire Road
properties.description: Longley Brothers shop and the Bexhill Observer office were destroyed. Today you can see these buildings were never rebuilt to their full height.

properties.name: 7 Westville Road
properties.description: Ms Edith E. Few (65) and Ms Lily A. Smith (54) killed by a low level bomb that had sliced through numbers 9 and 11. 5 injured.

properties.name: Adams Farm
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Barnhorn Road
properties.description: Three bombs dropped north of The Broadwalk in open country. The first bombs dropped on Bexhill.

properties.name: Barrack Road
properties.description: Direct hit on Barrack Road air raid shelter. No casualties.

properties.name: Barrack Road Cemetery
properties.description: Bomb landed amongst the graves, elm trees were uprooted and a piece of tombstone was hurled at a motor vehicle.

properties.name: Beach between Brockley Road and Richmond Road
Beach between Brockley Road and Richmond Road
Bexhill golf course
properties.description: Flying Bomb. 7 injured.

properties.name: Bexhill Hospital
properties.description: 9 bombs dropped. 1 injury to a patient by flying glass.

properties.name: Brassey Road, Suffolk House
properties.description: Bexhill's greatest loss of life in one incident. Ms Ada M. Adamson (75), Ms Jane C. Cana (84), Ms Edith L. Corke (39) and Ms Eleanor M. Coventry (65) killed. 2 other occupants seriously injured.

properties.name: Buckhurst Road
properties.description: Unexploded bomb. Exploded 22 May 2009 during building work.

properties.name: Buckhurst Road, Twinehams
properties.description: Mr John Croft (41) killed. Bexhill's first fatality. Two other workmen at premises injured.

properties.name: Caffyn's Garage, Station Road
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Cantelupe Road
properties.description: Landed on pavement but did not explode until five hours later.  Caused upheaval of the road and displacement of roof tiles on surrounding houses. No casualties.

properties.name: Collington Avenue, Collington Mansions
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Collington Wood
properties.description: Unexploded bomb, removed June 1946.

properties.name: Collington Wood
properties.description: Unexploded bomb, controlled explosion 05 December 1940.

properties.name: Coniston, Hartfield Road
properties.description: Flying bomb.

properties.name: Cooden Golf Links
properties.description: Land mine.

properties.name: De La Warr Pavilion
properties.description: Destroyed dressing rooms and some of the backstage area. The buildings foundations also suffered minor damage.

properties.name: Egerton Road, Fishers Yard
properties.description: Unexploded bomb which exploded 1st October at 01:15 hours.

properties.name: Field north of Pebsham Lane
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Glenleigh Park Road junction of Kingswood Avenue
Glovers Farm
properties.description: Flying bomb. 8 injured.

properties.name: Hastings Gas Works
properties.description: Low level attack, three bombs. 15 injured, of which Mr Bertram G. Niner (39) of Bulverhythe died 3 days later and Mr William M. Day (59) - also of Bulverhythe - died a fortnight later.

properties.name: Hastings Gas works
properties.description: Low level attack, three bombs. 15 injured, of which Mr Bertram G. Niner (39) of Bulverhythe died 3 days later and Mr William M. Day (59) - also of Bulverhythe - died a fortnight later.

properties.name: Hastings Gas Works
properties.description: Low level attack, three bombs. 15 injured, of which Mr Bertram G. Niner (39) of Bulverhythe died 3 days later and Mr William M. Day (59) - also of Bulverhythe - died a fortnight later.

properties.name: Highwoods golf course
properties.description: Flying bomb.

properties.name: Jameson Road
properties.description: Residential damage.

properties.name: Knole Court
properties.description: A bomb removed one of the gables and the two entrances.

properties.name: Maple Walk
properties.description: V1 damaged a residential dwelling named High Chimneys (now known as Maple House).

properties.name: Metropole Hotel
properties.description: Considerable damage to the front of the building, although unoccupied at the time a postman was badly injured by falling rubble. Beach Towers Hotel opposite also sustained damage causing loss of one of its turrets.

properties.name: Metropolitan Convalescence Home
properties.description: Flying bomb.

properties.name: Millfields Estate
properties.description: 5 injured.

properties.name: Millfields Estate
properties.description: 5 injured.

properties.name: Millfields Estate
properties.description: 5 injured.

properties.name: Motcombe Court
properties.description: A 500kg bomb demolished three upper floors of the east wing. The building was unoccupied apart from the caretaker who suffered superficial injuries. Rebuilt in 1946.

properties.name: New Park Avenue
properties.description: In roadway. Damage to nearby houses.

properties.name: Pebsham Farm
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Pebsham Farm
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Pebsham Marsh
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Pebsham Marsh
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Pebsham Marsh
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Pebsham Marsh
properties.description: Flying bomb.

properties.name: Post Office rear
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Railway siding near Bowles Yard, Reginald Road
Railway, London Road
properties.description: Rear of Corporation Yard.

properties.name: Reginald Road, rear of, by allotments
properties.description: Unexploded bomb. Detonated 19 April 1941.

properties.name: Richmond Road
properties.description: The first V1 that landed on the town. Damaged residential property and broke windows at St. Augustine's Church. Left a 30-ft-deep crater.

properties.name: Rotherfield Avenue
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Sackville Garage
properties.description: Completely destroyed.

properties.name: Sackville Hotel
properties.description: 4 small roof fires.

properties.name: Smiths Garage, Victoria Road
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: St Leonards Road
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: St Mary's Cottages by footpath from Highlands
The Gaiety Cinema
properties.description: 94 London Road, destroyed and never reopened.

properties.name: The Grange
properties.description: V1 landed in the garden grounds partially wrecking the house, also caused damage to the Bell Hotel and other adjacent properties. 27 injured.

properties.name: The Mount
properties.description: Flying bomb. 1 person injured.

properties.name: The New Club
properties.description: Unexploded bomb possibly dropped 09 October.

properties.name: Town Hall
properties.description: Town Hall Borough Accountant and Public Health Department.

properties.name: Town Hall
properties.description: Damage caused the Borough Accountant and Public Health Department to relocate to Garth Place.

properties.name: Town Hall Square
properties.description: Damage to shops. Located where the building passage to Sainsbury's is today.

properties.name: Turkey Road
properties.description: Bomb in front garden demolished bungalow and house next door. A terrace opposite (Arncliffe Terrace) was damaged. Families at Arncliffe Terrace and Camperdown Street evacuated.

properties.name: Wealden Way
properties.description: Home wrecked by a flying bomb.

properties.name: Worsham Manor
properties.description: Flying bomb.
